00019         class semaphore
00020         {
00021                 int v;
00022                 pthread_mutex_t mutex;
00023                 pthread_cond_t cond;
00024               public:
00025                   semaphore (int init_value = 1):v (init_value)
00026                 {
00027                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_init (&mutex, NULL));
00028                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_cond_init (&cond, NULL));
00029                 };
00030                  ~semaphore ()
00031                 {
00032                         int res = pthread_mutex_trylock (&mutex);
00033 
00034                         if (res == 0 || res == EBUSY)
00035                                   stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_unlock
00036                                                  (&mutex))
00037                                 else
00038                                   stxxl_function_error
00039                                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_destroy
00040                                                        (&mutex));
00041                           stxxl_nassert (pthread_cond_destroy (&cond));
00042 
00043                 };
00044                 // function increments the semaphore and signals any threads that
00045                 // are blocked waiting a change in the semaphore
00046                 int operator ++ (int)
00047                 {
00048                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_lock (&mutex));
00049                         int res = ++v;
00050                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_unlock (&mutex));
00051                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_cond_signal (&cond));
00052                         return res;
00053                 };
00054                 // function decrements the semaphore and blocks if the semaphore is
00055                 // <= 0 until another thread signals a change
00056                 int operator -- (int)
00057                 {
00058                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_lock (&mutex));
00059                         while (v <= 0)
00060                                 stxxl_nassert (pthread_cond_wait
00061                                                (&cond, &mutex));
00062                         int res = --v;
00063                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_unlock (&mutex));
00064                         return res;
00065                 };
00066                 // function does NOT block but simply decrements the semaphore
00067                 // should not be used instead of down -- only for programs where
00068                 // multiple threads must up on a semaphore before another thread
00069                 // can go down, i.e., allows programmer to set the semaphore to
00070                 // a negative value prior to using it for synchronization.
00071                 int decrement ()
00072                 {
00073                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_lock (&mutex));
00074                         int res = --v;
00075                         stxxl_nassert (pthread_mutex_unlock (&mutex));
00076                         return res;
00077                 };
00078                 // function returns the value of the semaphore at the time the
00079                 // critical section is accessed.  obviously the value is not guarenteed
00080                 // after the function unlocks the critical section.
